Screenshot: http://docs.rudev.org/stream/672c19dafdce3dba2af194a335ea1a55

First emitter (index 0) contents '- Image Path -' image directory, but not real path. This problem can be corrected if remove "premultipliedAlpha" line, but... this is wrong.

I was looking for a long time error, so I think it should be added try\catch inside loadEmitterImages method.

Sorry for bad English =)

data.title: Add outline and shadow rendering to gdx-freetype [Updated]
data.body:
This is a PR for previously added enhancement by @Doccrazy [PR 2191](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/2191). Created to speed up the integration of such an awesome feature.

This PR contains my commit - minor fixing of performance, based on comments from @badlogic and @MobiDevelop (I've compared the font generation in my game and got average ~2.2 seconds instead of ~2.7 without this fixes for 5 font generations on my machine, so it might not be so bad).

However, please review my changes  thoroughly.

data.title: Gdx.net.sendHttpRequest not work after  Package for App Store/Ad-Hoc distribution...
java.lang.NullPointerException at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextMarkup.setDefaultChunk
Prevent NetJavaImpl from blocking new requests during listener method execution
data.body:
This PR fixes #2656. 
I moved the `lock.lock()` and `lock.unlock()` methods to only lock access to the listeners and connections maps. Other methods, especially `listener.handleHttpResponse()`, `listener.failed()` and `listener.cancelled()` are now lock free. Otherwise longer operations within these listener methods (like downloading a huge file) would block access to the connections and listeners maps and therefore new http requests would wait until these methods have finished execution (like the file has been downloaded).

data.title: Add out/, classes/, gen-external-apklibs/ to .gitignore
data.body: “out/”, “classes/” and "gen-external-apklibs/" are generated in Intellij IDEA ,maven and android-maven-plugin environment.

data.title: Bullet btFixedConstraint missing
data.body: I've tried the latest stable and the latest nightly and it seems that the btFixedConstraint is missing from the wrapper. All 5 other constraints from [this](http://bulletphysics.org/mediawiki-1.5.8/index.php/Constraints) article are in the wrapper, but btFixedConstraint is not.

data.title: add stop method into AudioRecorder interface
data.body: should be able to stop AudioRecorder recording.

data.title: should be able to record audio on iOS
data.body: Currently newAudioDevice/newAudioRecorder is not implemented in IOSAudio. However,  It should be a basic and import feature.

data.title: Touch coordinates are wrong on iOS if UIStatusBarHidden is false
data.body:
I previously posted [this](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/robovm/8Q_crAlkxYw) on the RoboVM forums, but Niklas directed me this way. 

I noticed my touches are reported as being half a centimeter or so lower than where I'm really pressing. This happens with a app on iOS when UIStatusBarHidden is set to false. When the status bar is hidden, touch coordinates are correct. The offset is about the size of the status bar, so I think this isn't being taken into account somehow? Test case [here](http://pastebin.com/CG5SDVKi). 

It's barely noticeable most of the time, but, for instance, if you hit the bottom of buttons in a stage they don't respond. Easy fix by hiding it anyway.

Everything else is glorious, keep it up! :D

data.title: Add exception in mesh and update the test of http request.
Make cullingArea in Group protected
data.body: This is useful for classes overriding methods like drawChildren, since cullingArea does not even have a getter (only setter).

data.title: Crash in native code while asynchronously loading TextureAtlas
data.body:
libGDX 1.5.3, JVM 8, OSX 10.10, other platforms not checked yet.

I'm seeing a crash when loading a TextureAtlas through the AssetManager that does not occur if I load from the main thread. 

The TextureAtlas is multiple pages of PNGs, 1024x1024, generated by TexturePacker. The crash occurs after multiple page loads -- the dependency resolution seems to have it working backward from page 9, and the crash often occurs by page 5.

I can add an error log, but it's huge, so here are the parts I found interesting:

```
#
# A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:
#
#  SIGBUS (0xa) at pc=0x00007fff8973e512, pid=65013, tid=122375
#
# JRE version: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (8.0_25-b17) (build 1.8.0_25-b17)
# Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (25.25-b02 mixed mode bsd-amd64 compressed oops)
# Problematic frame:
# C  [libsystem_platform.dylib+0x1512]  _platform_memmove$VARIANT$Nehalem+0x1d2
```

```
Stack: [0x000000012701e000,0x000000012711e000],  sp=0x000000012710ff40,  free space=967k
Native frames: (J=compiled Java code, j=interpreted, Vv=VM code, C=native code)
C  [libsystem_platform.dylib+0x1512]  _platform_memmove$VARIANT$Nehalem+0x1d2
C  [libgdx64.dylib+0x24b19]  stbi__getn+0x99
C  [libgdx64.dylib+0x23e64]  stbi__parse_png_file+0x974
C  [libgdx64.dylib+0x6b83]  stbi_load_main+0x203
C  [libgdx64.dylib+0x14dd2]  gdx2d_load+0x72
C  [libgdx64.dylib+0x14ce]  Java_com_badlogic_gdx_graphics_g2d_Gdx2DPixmap_load+0x3e
j  com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Gdx2DPixmap.load([J[BII)Ljava/nio/ByteBuffer;+0
j  com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Gdx2DPixmap.<init>([BIII)V+19
j  com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap.<init>(Lcom/badlogic/gdx/files/FileHandle;)V+24
```

```
Registers:
RAX=0x000000012341c000, RBX=0x00000000000b8000, RCX=0x000000000000000f, RDX=0xffffffffffe46fb0
RSP=0x000000012710ff40, RBP=0x000000012710ff40, RSI=0x0000000780b09c4d, RDI=0x0000000123263030
R8 =0x0000000000000153, R9 =0x00000000000000cc, R10=0x0000000000000000, R11=0x000000012341bfff
R12=0x00000000ffffffff, R13=0x000000012711d208, R14=0x000000012341c000, R15=0xffffffffffffffff
RIP=0x00007fff8973e512, EFLAGS=0x0000000000010282, ERR=0x0000000000000006
  TRAPNO=0x000000000000000e
```

I understand this as [stb_image trying to parse an IDAT chunk](https://github.com/nothings/stb/blob/ec2158386c877a2388038d0587f22b129a2cc03e/stb_image.h#L4282). My calling-convention-fu is weak but if RDX is supposed to be parameter 3 to stbi__getn, that is suspect. 

I considered a corrupt PNG (generated by TexturePacker), or a failed realloc, but the latter should have already been handled by stb_image, and if I load the TextureAtlas on the main thread, there is no error.

Any ideas?

data.title: Gdx.input.getTextInput window is hidden by the main app windows on Windows 7.
data.body:
Test case. The app is windowed, the window covers most of the screen space. There is the button to call Gdx.input.getTextInput. No input window appear after pressing the button. If the user press Alt-Tab the input window appears (so it was existing, but just covered by the main window). After that one can close the input window and open it again, works like expected. The problem arise again after fresh app start. The problem appears for me only on Window 7. Mac OS X work like expected.

Another problem is when the user accidentally clicks outside the input window and activated main app window. The input window disappears again without any clear indication that it is still working and how to bring it back.

Probably the best option would be to make it modal and to force it to front.

data.title: Loading TextureMapObject from TMX file
data.body:
Hey

I ran into a problem while developing. In my tmx maps, I use texture objects. During parsing the map, I noticed that these objects were only loaded as RectangleObjects. As I was reviewing the loader, I noticed that [TextureMapObjects](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/26f1c3fbc5a96ffd9e63d31c2b07f8d5dac9c95d/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/maps/objects/TextureMapObject.java), were never created.

I edited the BaseTmxMapLoader, so that these Objects are created as well. They'll be added to the map the same way as the other MapObjects are.

I'm not sure if somebody else already fixed this (searched, but didn't found anything) or if I completely missed a point somewhere, so I'd love if somebody could review this :)

data.title: TextButton label customization.
data.body:
Skin.get now also returns resource that are subclasses of the given
type.
Implemented a method createLabel in the Label.LabelStyle class, which
permits to instantiate the proper subclass of Label without knowing it.
Added a labelStyle field to TextButton.TextButtonStyle which allows
TextButton to use a subclass of Label instantiating it with the
createLabel method.

Added DynamicChildActorsTest to test the above functionalities.

data.title: Rename x to other letter ('value' or 'v') on MathUtils for floor/ceil methods
data.body:
Some IDEs warns you for using values named 'y' or 'height' on a method
that requires 'x' or 'width', this will fix the minor issue.

Reason for pull request: http://imgur.com/Kk8dOat,YNzV084

I didn't really tested or anything because this shouldn't cause any issue at all.

data.title: Type top ... is not assignable to reference type
Zero alpha actions don't work over a TextField
data.body:
Zero alpha actions over a TextField don't behave in the same way as (for instance) Label. Background, cursor and those style properties do it properly but not the text contained within the widget. A http://sscce.org/ is provided here:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/17018559/PlayGround.zip

Touch/click to test it

data.title: [WIZ] Box2d EndContact does not called.
Fix Issue 2475 by packing the JFrame before setting visible.
data.body: On Linux systems, GDXSetup comes up as a blank window. Packing the JFrame before setting it visible resolves the issue. There are other issues (e.g., some labels don't correctly paint before initial mouse hover), and questions (e.g., why the explicit setSize()?), but those should probably be addressed in one or more other PRs.

data.title: Add IOSDevice enum for PPI, fixes #2736
data.body: Tested on (one) device. If anyone wants to send me the rest of the devices I can test the rest ;)

data.title: Add the ability to set alpha component to BitmapFontCache keeping RGB
data.body:
This is usefull when using different colors in the BitmapFontCache ; is you want to fade he text, you need to change alpha and not RGB. The other functions don't do that.

I did not change the draw method of BitmapFontCache to use this instead of setColors because this would make a (small) API change. Just tell me if you would prefer the draw method to only update the alpha part (base don alphaModulation parameter) and I will add the commit.

data.title: build.gradle for Android in IntelliJ IDEA
data.body:
Hello guys,

After upgrade to gradle:1.0.0 there is some issue when importing a project to IntelliJ IDEA.

For example. I've created a new libGDX project with the latest gdx-setup.jar (without an 'html' subproject). Once imported into IntelliJ IDEA, in the project explorer, only 'core', 'desktop' and 'ios' words are bolded ('android' is not).

When I open File -> Project Structure... -> Modules (under the "Project settings") -> android, there is no content root under "Sources" and "Dependencies" contains only Android API 21 Platform and <Module source>.

It looks like the build.gradle inside the 'android' folder doesn't work properly for new Gradle in IntelliJ IDEA.

I have tried to package an android release from the command line for one of my projects with several outside dependencies (gradlew android:assembleRelease) and the build was successful. So the issue is in the config for IDEA.

I have tried an older version of gdx-setup.jar (downloaded on 11/28/2014) that has dependency on com.android.tools.build:gradle:0.13+ . It generates new projects without such troubles.

I am new to Gradle and don't now how to resolve this issue on my own. Please, help me.

Kind regards,
Serhii
